Movies & TV Shows.name: Retro Rewind: Classic TV & Film
Movies & TV Shows.description: Test your knowledge of iconic television shows and beloved films from decades past. From classic sitcoms to blockbuster movies, this quiz will challenge your memory of entertainment history. Can you recall the details of these memorable moments?

questions.text: What actress starred on 'Charlie's Angels' for the show's entire run?
questions.hint: She played Kelly Garrett, a key detective throughout all five seasons.

questions.text: In the 1976 remake of the classic film 'King Kong' what New York landmark does the giant ape climb?
questions.hint: This was a modern skyscraper in New York at the time, unlike the original film's setting.

questions.text: What sport is featured in the 1996 movie 'Kingpin'?
questions.hint: This sport involves rolling a ball to knock down pins in a lane.

questions.text: In Mister Rogers' theme song, what does he ask you to be?
questions.hint: This term reflects the friendly, community-focused theme of the show.

questions.text: In the 1992 animated film 'Aladdin' what device does the hero use to travel from place to place?
questions.hint: This item is a fantastical mode of transport, often associated with Middle Eastern tales.

questions.text: Which of these movies does not star Jim Carrey?
questions.hint: This film features a different comedic actor as a compassionate doctor.

questions.text: In the original 'Get Smart' TV series, what is agent Maxwell Smart's code name?
questions.hint: His code name is a two-digit number, reflecting his bumbling yet effective spy persona.

Movies & TV Shows.name: Pop Culture Parody: A Comedy Quiz
Movies & TV Shows.description: Dive into the world of comedic movies and TV shows with this lighthearted quiz. From spoofs to satire, test your knowledge of the funniest moments in entertainment. Get ready to laugh your way to the top!

questions.text: Which of these television programs did not feature characters introduced on 'Happy Days'?
questions.hint: This show about cousins in Chicago has no connection to the ‘Happy Days’ universe.

questions.text: In the movie 'Austin Powers: The Spy Who Shagged Me' what is the name of Dr. Evil's diminutive clone?
questions.hint: The name is a playful reference to his small size and resemblance to Dr. Evil.

questions.text: In the sci-fi movie 'Fantastic Voyage' where do the voyagers travel?
questions.hint: The journey takes place in a microscopic world inside a living organism.
questions.option4: to the center of the earth

Movies & TV Shows.description: Step into the shadows and test your knowledge of the most chilling movies and TV shows. From psychological thrillers to supernatural horrors, this quiz will challenge your understanding of the genre's darkest corners. Are you brave enough to face the fright?

questions.text: What substance was used for blood in the famous shower scene from the movie 'Psycho'?
questions.hint: This sweet, thick liquid was chosen for its dark appearance in black-and-white film.

questions.text: Which of these actors did one-handed push-ups on stage at the 1992 Academy Awards?
questions.hint: This actor was an older, tough-guy star who won for ‘City Slickers.’

questions.text: On the TV show 'Hill Street Blues' what is Joyce Davenport's nickname for Captain Frank Furillo?
questions.hint: The nickname reflects his Italian heritage and a casual, affectionate term.

questions.text: In the film 'Easy Rider' what emblem is on the back of Peter Fonda's leather jacket?
